sub_title: Child Rights Activist | Program Management & Implementation | Non Profit Consulting | Socio-Cultural Anthropologist
summary:
More than 8 years of experience working on the issues of rights of the vulnerable population by managing and implementing programs, conducting research, and building capacities of the government and non-government stakeholders through training and program implementation for Child Sexual Exploitation (CSE) and  Gender Based Violence (GBV), creating training modules, and case management of CSE on the ground and online spaces. 
Also experienced in strengthening organizational structure and policies and I have experience in supporting community-based organizations (CBOs) in strengthening their organizational capacities by building a solid structure. 
With knowledge and experience in working at the grassroots as well as at the senior management level, I am a resourceful, committed, problem solver, efficient, and energetic person who has developed a mature and responsible approach to any task given, or situation presented with; and thrives on challenges and opportunities to make a difference.

projects.title: Exploring culture at a height: Understanding the role of  kinship and marriages in Ladakh

contributors.headline: Child Rights Activist | Program Management & Implementation | Non Profit Consulting | Socio-Cultural Anthropologist

profile_positions.description:
- Worked on organizational development by providing technical assistance and strong management and technical oversight to the partners working with Children and People Living with HIV
- Supported the civil society organizations (CSOs) to ensure the availability and delivery of high-quality technical assistance in the organizational capacity areas of program management, program quality, governance, financial management, resource mobilization, client needs and image, networking, and partnership
- Contributed to the implementation of innovative financing models including social enterprise
- Measured and reported the result of the technical assistance provided to local organizations for donor reporting and sharing with external stakeholders
- Represented the organization before key stakeholders including USAID, government, NGO partners, private sector, and others
- Documented project activities by making PowerPoint presentations, writing abstracts, developing technical briefs, writing blogs, etc
- Collaborated with other USAID partners to ensure synergy in the technical assistance to strengthen the organizational capacity of CSOs
- Maintained and monitor the project-specific information in order to respond fully to donor reporting requirements
- Managed the sub- awardee's program implementation, budgets, and the program implementation team.
profile_positions.title: Capacity Development Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Designed and implemented strategies, plans, and procedures of multiple projects. 
- Prepared detailed project plans, proposals, created and maintained budgets, and managed team members and resources.
-  Liaison	with	multiple	stakeholders from the government, non-government and corporate sectors.
-  Conducted needs assessment and research in order to strengthen the programs and services. Based on the results, planned comprehensive goals for performance and growth of the programs. 
- Developed best practices and tools for effective functioning of the child protection systems on ground.
-  Conducted and documented studies and rapid assessments on the effects of COVID-19 on children and their families and the frontline workers of the NGOs.  
-  Developed content and training modules for capacity development of the child protection systems, gender-equitable boys, sexual and reproductive health of adolescents, and life skills for adolescents. 
- Conducted training for various stakeholders on the issue of Child Rights, child rights laws, Gender & Patriarchy, Child Sexual Abuse Prevention, Understanding Men & Boys, and Online Safety. 
-  Established policies that promote company culture and vision
-  Lead employees to encourage maximum performance and dedication
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Manager (Child Sexual Abuse Onground & Online Spaces)

profile_positions.description:
- Oversee the project activities and be the focal contact point between the partners and the field staff to guarantee smooth implementation of activities and achievement of results as per the goal of the project. 
- Ensured project activities comply with the policies and regulations of the partnership.
- Oversee the development and execution of project deliverables, budgeting, action plans, and monitor the processes.
-  Documented the activity reports, quarterly and annual reports, and financial reports.
- Worked closely with the child welfare committee, police, one-stop crises centers in the hospitals, district women and child officers, district child protection units, courts, and civil society organizations. 
- Provided guidance and intervention in more than 275 cases of child sexual abuse across districts of Mumbai, Thane, Raigad, and Pune. 
- Participated and coordinated various training and conferences around the issues of child protection, child sexual abuse, and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act 2012. 
Conducted training for various stakeholders (Police, Child Protection Functionaries, Teacher and Parents) on the issue of Child Right’s laws, Gender & Patriarchy, Child Sexual Abuse Prevention
profile_positions.title: Project Manager (Child Sexual Abuse Prevention and Protection)

company.name: SNEHA (Society for Nutrition Education and Health Action )

profile_positions.company: SNEHA (Society for Nutrition, Education and Health Action)
profile_positions.description:
Conducted Qualitative Research on the perspective, motivations, and challenges of frontline workers (field workers of Civil Society Organizations and Anganwadi workers) in the development sector of Mumbai.

- Carried out desktop research, using a range of methods and sources of data
- Assisted in developing the research design and the question guide.
- Conducted individual interviews and focused group discussions in order to collect data
- Conducted qualitative analysis of data conducted through interviews, focus groups, and field observation. 
- Coded of the collected data
- Worked closely with others as part of a team and with external stakeholders to manage relationships and deliver work.
- Organized, designed, and carried out qualitative fieldwork in different locations and contexts across Mumbai and Pune.  
- Managed data, project, and administration related to the research study.
profile_positions.title: Qualitative Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Managed the project of Johnson and Johnson (Bridge to Employment) in collaboration with  Prerana for providing assistance to underprivileged children in formal education.
- Oversee the project activities 
- Ensured project activities comply with the policies and regulations of the donor organization.
- Oversee the development and execution of project deliverables. 
- Responsible for submitting activity reports, quarterly reports, and meeting minutes to the donor
- Liaison with various stakeholders school principals, teachers, students, external resources, corporate staff, volunteers. 
- Work closely with the children and young adults 
- Organize and coordinate sessions for children and teachers in order to build their capacities. 
- Conducted needs assessment and research in order to strengthen the programs and services. Based on the results, planned comprehensive goals for performance and growth of the programs.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager (Child Protection)

profile_positions.description:
Provided consultation in a research on “Diagnosis and treatment of children suffering from pneumonia by private providers, drug seller and caregivers” in Barabanki and Shahjahanpur district, Uttar Pradesh, India.
- Data collection through one on one interview, focused group discussion, participant observation
- Designing the question guide
- Transcription of the data collected
profile_positions.title: Consultant- Qualitative Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: We provide psychosocial support intervention  to the children by planning sessions that allow children to relieve stress and tension caused as a result of war or fights and support them in creating a sense of security within themselves and help them express and navigate the emotions, to help them for their healthy development.
